      • changeDateFormat

        public static java.lang.String changeDateFormat(java.lang.String date)
        Date format changer from dd-mm-yyyy to yyyy-MM-dd . but if input date is in yyyy-MM-dd this does nothing / used by daysExceeded() method

      • daysExceeded

        public static int daysExceeded(java.lang.String returnDateAttribute,
               java.lang.String dueDateAttribute)
        No of Days Exceeded calculator. Then Fine = chargePerDay * return value of this method.
        Parameters:
        returnDateAttribute -
        dueDateAttribute -
        Returns:
        int days exceeded

      • changeResultSetDateFormat

        public static javax.swing.table.TableModel changeResultSetDateFormat(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                                     javax.swing.table.TableModel model,
                                                     java.lang.Integer[] fields)
                                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Changes date format from dd-mm-yyyy to mysql's yyyy-mm-dd in a result set for specified fields THIS METHOD FAILS BECAUSE WE THE INPUT RESULTSET SELECTS DATA FROM MANY TABLES. HENCE CONCUR UPDATABLE FAILS. IT IS APPLICABLE TO ONLY 1 TABLE.
        Parameters:
        rs - The resultSet whose date format are to be changed
        fields - String Array that stores the name of date fields
        Returns:
        ResultSet rs with modified date formats
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
